00082 #if !defined(FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE)
00083 namespace fastformat
00084 {
00085 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_NO_NAMESPACE */
00086 
00087 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00088  * Classes
00089  */

00096 class mismatched_arguments_scope_base
00097 {
00098 public: // Member Types
00100     typedef mismatched_arguments_scope_base     class_type;
00101 
00102 protected: // Construction
00108     explicit mismatched_arguments_scope_base(fastformat_mismatchedHandler_t handler, void* param)
00109         : m_previous(fastformat_setThreadMismatchedHandler(handler, param))
00110     {}
00111 public:
00118     virtual ~mismatched_arguments_scope_base() throw()
00119     {
00120         fastformat_setThreadMismatchedHandler(m_previous.handler, m_previous.param);
00121     }
00122 
00123 protected: // Operations
00126     int handle_default(
00127         void*                   /* param */
00128     ,   ff_replacement_code_t   code
00129     ,   size_t                  numParameters
00130     ,   int                     parameterIndex
00131     ,   ff_string_slice_t*      slice
00132     ,   void*                   reserved0
00133     ,   size_t                  reserved1
00134     ,   void*                   reserved2
00135     )
00136     {
00137         if(NULL == m_previous.handler)
00138         {
00139             return +1; // Ignore unreferenced argument
00140         }
00141         else
00142         {
00143             return (m_previous.handler)(m_previous.param, code, numParameters, parameterIndex, slice, reserved0, reserved1, reserved2);
00144         }
00145     }
00146 
00147 private:
00148     mismatched_arguments_scope_base(class_type const&);
00149     class_type& operator =(class_type const&);
00150 
00151 protected:  // A (very) rare use case for protected member data, when using (private) implementation inheritance
00152     mismatched_handler_info_t   m_previous; 
00153 };
00154
